Reviews.Title: “Great Location....Clean,Clean, Clean, Clean”
Reviews.Author: aaron h
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the HW between March 18/20 in a single room with an ensuite bathroom. Americans that have never been to EU they may be surprised at how small the room and bathroom are. The room was very comfortable and I cannot express how clean it was. Location was fabulous. Just a very short walk to Kings Cross St. Pancras station. Lots of restaurants, shopping, etc. nearby. You cannot beat the location for the price. The only issues that I have are: that there is no elevator, I had several bags since I was on trip for both personal and business so was traveling for 2wks. I was put on the top floor and had to lug all of these heavy bags up a very narrow stairway, I was disapointed that there was no offer from the hotel staff to help me with my bags. The other issue is that the hotel still uses actual metal keys for the room and there is no secondary lock on the door. This didnt bother me so much but I would not let my wife or daughter sleep in one of these rooms alone. It also would have been nice if there were a phone in the room and if WIFI was available.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, central area..”
Reviews.Author: Toshney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HW for 3 nights, the room & bathroom were compact but clean & cosy - what we expected, for the price we paid. Whilst we were there we had maid service daily, consisting of a supply off fresh towels & room clearing...current maids are completely trust worthy as my partner in crime often left his suitcase wide open with clothes spilling out and on one occasion with his laptop right on top hehe ...so no issues in that department (mentioning laptop.. this place offers free wifi .. just ask for the password at reception). Breakfast was filling, they offer a full English (beans, egg, bacon rashers & good sausages - that's a good enough English for me.. not bothered about tomatoes or mushrooms!) together with toast & marmalade/jam/butter/choc spread/honey, a pot Tea or Coffee & glass of juice. On one occasion I just felt like some bacon & toast...where I was given extra slices seeing as I just had that, and my breakfast partners' plates had nothing missing from theirs’ ..as regards the staff.. sometimes you have to understand that different cultures act in different ways, however they were always well mannered & to the point. Breakfast is from 0700 - 0900hrs, yes at 0900hrs we were advised that breakfast time was up, but still politely - there was one gentleman who wasn't quite finished yet & I didn't see them chucking him out - I have a feeling that the b’fast staff are the cleaning ladies too, so understandable that they'd wish to get on with their duties - that's what times are given for I guess ^_^ The hotel is in an extremely central, quiet & clean area, literally minutes walking distance from Kings Cross. I would stay at this hotel again if I was going to be in the area - it's not a luxurious hotel, if you want luxury go to a 5 star place & be prepared to pay for it...what I look for a place when travelling, is mainly a clean/cosy room & bed to sleep in, clean bathroom to wash in & most importantly feel safe - I feel we got what we wanted & good value for money here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, basic accomodation”
Reviews.Author: minafs
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this Hotel for 4 nights mid-March 2012. Room was small but clean, bed comfortable, ensuite clean. Room cleaning and change of towels carried out each day. Good English breakfast each morning consisting of sausage, fried eggs, baked beans and bacon. Also included pot of tea or coffee, toast and glass of orange. This hotel is in a quiet area and few minutes away from King's Cross station (tube). Staff very friendly and efficient. The only thing we found irritating was the creaking of the roof whenever someone moved in the room upstairs, either very early in the morning or late at night!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, basic accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Ginguar
Reviews.Content: Firstly after spending hours trawling through trip advisor i found this hotel, reading both negative & positive feedbacks we decided to give it a go as it was at the cheaper end of the scale. Stayed here for 3 nights end of feb into march with my wife & 3 year old son. Had a room with a double and single bed in it. This meant it was a bit of a squeeze, but for the price what more do you expect! Room was cleaned everyday, no problem with that aspect. Things are dated & do need modernising, especially the toilet/shower room. Beds were like"put me ups" & small to say the least, but comfortable enough. Breakfast was basically what you were given, "full English" minus tomatoes, hash browns, black pudding , fried bread or mushrooms! Not exactly full. Even though we had paid for our 3 year old we asked for just beans & sausage for him which he got, sadly they were then missing off our plates! Reception staff were always friendly and greet you with a smile, more than can be said than the eastern Europeans who did he breakfast & housekeeping. Breakfast ended at 9, And not a minute longer as they basically chased you out, finished or not! Overall great location, clean, fairly friendly but in need of updating. Would recommend for a cheap break.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad for a cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rach980
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel last night after attending the Noel Gallagher gig at the O2. It is only a few minutes from the Kings Cross tube station, and in a fairly quiet square with a pleasant garden. The reception was ok, friendly staff, but we arrived back at the hotel yesterday at around 4pm and couldn't get in - they had locked the front door and didn't respond to the bell-ringing. He eventually turned up to let us in after about ten minutes - no explanations about where he'd been. The room wasn't bad for a cheap hotel - basic but the beds were comfortable.The ensuite was basic but ok. The breakfast this morning was again, not bad - a full English is thrown in with everyone's stay. This consisted of bacon, fried egg, sausage and baked beans; there was also a fairly suspect glass of 'orange juice', tea or coffee and toast. The main problem was the noise in the hotel. We arrived back to the room at midnight, exhausted after a night standing, and went straight to sleep. However, we were woken at 2am, 4pm and 6pm by three separate loads of guests/ deliveries arriving - our room was on the ground floor next to reception and the window looked straight onto the street so this might not have been an issue for other guests. No attempt was made to keep the noise down and we had a very disturbed night's sleep. It was a shame because otherwise, i would go back there - but if I'm staying in London I need my sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly but noisy”
Reviews.Author: fancyrats
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only a few minutes walk from Kings Cross and a pretty good price for its location. I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful, and thought the breakfast better than many that I've had in similar hotels. I paid Â£45 a night for a single ensuite and thought that price would be difficult to beat. The bed was also surprisingly good for a budget hotel - I suspect it was reasonably new. However, there's definitely a price to paid for budget. The rooms were small, particularly the ensuites, although not impractically so. They were also very warm, although that is perhaps because they were small. My room seemed clean when I entered, but day-to-day cleaning was perhaps not thorough as I might have expected. The main reason why I might not stay again is the noise. There was very little street noise, but I could hear much of the noise within the hotel - the TV in other rooms, the movement of people above, footsteps on the stairs. The hotel didn't quieten down until about midnight but I was woken every morning before seven by breakfast preparations. To the Scottish family, who stomped and trumped their way down the stairs every morning at 7am on the dot, I'm glad you made the most of your time in London but it wasn't the pleasantest start to my day. I don't know whether other rooms are quieter, but on the ground floor, I got to hear everyone coming down the stairs, and their conversations. It is a well-run, pleasant and friendly hotel in a good location but you may need to be a heavy sleeper or bring some earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Not a nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Stevepj35
Reviews.Content: From outside the Hotel looks plush however don't be impressed. I paid Â£65 for the room and its really not worth it. The room was small, and although the bed looked clean the bedroom and bathroom were filthy - layer of dust on TV and side table, previous guests hair in the shower, tabacco smell etc. It was very noisy at night, could hear lots of things going on in the hotel. Because the room was filthy I didn't trust the kitchen therefore went somewhere else for breakfast. Fortunately I was only staying for one night on business otherwise i would have asked to change rooms or i would have found a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, but not bad”
Reviews.Author: GabbieN
Reviews.Content: It was a reasonably ok stay. There was no in-room coffee or tea. I wish they would have allowed us to leave our luggage in the room before it was ready, we had to leave it in a fully accessible breakfast room, so I carried my computer with me all day before we could come back. The walls are extremely thin, we could hear the people nest to us talking, even though they used a fairly low voice. The knobs on heaters were falling off. Note that you have to ask the front desk to turn on the heating, if you want your room warm, and again the next day, because they will turn it off. The bathtub had hairs in it, I don't think the cleaning job was too thorough, the shower head was nearly entirely clogged with rock deposit. There is nowhere to hang towels. The breakfast ends at 9am sharp, at 9:10 the breakfast room was dark and set for the next day, the staff refused to give us anything, so we went to a nearby coffee shop. I think they chase people out before 9am to be able to tidy up by 9. I would say that it is one of the best choices in that city square, which is full of very low budget hotels, including a salvation army. The area felt relatively safe, though. It is quite a walk to downtown and the usual tourist sites, about 30+ min fast walk, but it is very near the King's Cross subway and the Pancras International rail station. You will probably need a day pass for subway to see the sites, though, or I recommend staying closer to the river. Next time I will stay closer to Thames, so that I could just walk to the sites, since the subway day-pass is not cheap (7 Â£). If you are traveling by rail, take advantage of Virgin Rail 2-for-1 admission to most of the important sites, it saves a large amount of money. No TV (but who has time for that) and no phone, again, wasn't needed. Internet worked fine.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Close”
Reviews.Author: gdubwoolley
Reviews.Content: After looking at the reviews of this Hotel I was a little worried about booking here with my group of 11 Football fanatics - took the leap anyway - NO regrets - it was clean and overall a friendly place to be - good restaurants all around and the amazing Camden Town Markets only a 15 min walk away - if you have a good arm you can hit the train station with a rock - breakfast was fine - wouldnt scramble an egg for any of our group of 11 which we all thought was quite odd - dont expect to be collimodeled at breakfast - all the B.S about no seating in the reviews is crap - we came down at 8am every morning and had food on the table with toast -tea or coffee withing 3 mins, The rooms are small but so is England get on with it - would stay again in a heart-beat - WARMAN - FROM SEDRO - WOOLLEY - WA - USA

Reviews.Title: “Not the worse hotel in Lond”
Reviews.Author: marturans
Reviews.Content: I visited London and lived three nights in this hotel. Very small room (barely 4 square meters) with a very strange bathroom in which no separation between WC and shower. It was scarcely cleaned and the windows was broken so I had to close its courtains in order not to have my room iced. Location was good as it very close to King Cross Station from where you can get any place in London. British breakfast was good though. It is a budget hotel located in a very expensive city, so do not complain too much!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Lou22091983
Reviews.Content: My husband, 4 year old little boy and I stayed at the Howard Winchester for 2 seperate nights stay. We were travelling on the Eurostar early in the morning and wanted a hotel near by. Of all the reviews this hotel seem the best so we booked it through booking.com Â£90 for the 3 of us, including full english breakfast. On arrival the lobby area was nicely decorated (it was Xmas time) and smelt very festive. An english speaking man - who i think is the owner checked us in and directed us to out room. We had room 34 which was on the ground floor just to the side of the reception. When we opened the door the 1st thing i noticed was how clean it smelt. The decor was clean and when you opened the wardrobe you could smell that it had recently being cleaned. In our room was a double bed and a single bed with plenty of room to move around the beds. There was a sink in the room then there was a frosted door that had a toliet and shower at the other side of it. We all had a towel left on the end of our bed. There was also a wardrobe and LCD TV with freeview We left the room and went into London for the afternoon, when we returned the room was lovely, cosy and warm. The beds were very comfy. The only fault we could find with the hotel, which isn't even really a fault, is that as it's a really old building the floorboards above us were very creaky and you could hear people walking around above you. In the morning we could smell breakfast being cooked. We went down to the breakfast room, which again was very tidy and clean. We were seated straight away, given a glass of fresh orange each and then brought a pot of tea and basket of toast. 2 mins later our cooked breakfast was brought out. It was really tasty, nice thick cut bacon and fresh sausauge. If you don't want a cooked breakfast they do have cereal that they offer to our little boy, but he wanted sausage and egg. When it came to checking out and paying we were dealt with by a nice english lady - who again i think was the owner. The location could be better, as soon as you step out of the front door you can see Kings Cross station and St Pancras is just next door. We returned 4 days later, late in the evening and had the same room. Again we had another pleasent experience. All in all i think this hotel was excellent value for money and would defiantly recommond and go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and very clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: DCuthill
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from staying in this hotel on 24 Nov 11 with my husband and young son. On checking in the hotel quite early in the morning, we are told that our room wasnt cleaned yet but that we could still leave our luggage in it, which we thought was very kind of the owner Carmelina, to let us do that. Our triple room was located on the ground floor and it was extremely clean, when I retuned later on they day they had left us clean towels to use, which i thought was nice of them. The bathroom was just the right size and it too was clean. There was hardly any noise at night so we all slept pretty well. The location of the hotel is fantastic, it is literally 2 mins away from kings cross station which was brill for us especially with a 5 year old to manage. The breakfast was lovely and cooked to perfection. I did find one of the kitchen staff to be very sour faced but the owners of the hotel Carmelina and her husband Tom made up for her. They were so helpful and very pleasant to deal with. I was so Impressed with the hotel, that I cancelled the hotel that I had booked for another trip in Jan 12 to stay with them again and it was also cheaper as well. I would highly recommend this hotel to stay in. I have stayed in London quite a bit over the years and so I know what is decent and what is not, and this hotel is the 2nd best one I've ever stayed in (my first choice hotel is now closed).

Reviews.Title: “good for 1 person & across from train station”
Reviews.Author: kristivflgirl1
Reviews.Content: i had a twin room..omly 55 pounds..across street from St pancras/Kings Cross station so easy to access Tube & Eurostar trains..nice reception & manager..open 24 hours..free wifi worked good..room was small bit had own bathroom with shower sink , mirror..also, had a armoire to hang clothes and a tv..quiet..no lift but not very many stairs..luggage storage if needed..would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located but not a place to use for more than 1 night.”
Reviews.Author: feralglow
Reviews.Content: I have used this hotel twice in the last 2 years when attending an event in London and found it is just about OK as a place to sleep for a night in the sense that it's not too pricey for central London and the beds are clean and comfortable. However I would never stay for more than 1 night as it's not a place you could relax. The rooms are not that clean and there is mould and mildew in the shower. The walls are thin so any noise in the corridors or nearby rooms wakes you. Breakfasts are OK but the eating area is far too small, the staff serving are not polite and speak very poor English. The staff generally are poor. Most have little interest in helping with any problems or queries and none speak good English. If you want a cheapish place for 1 night you can cope with it's many flaws though.

Reviews.Title: “Served a purpose”
Reviews.Author: LPML1977
Reviews.Content: We got into London Kings Cross late in the evening and were catching the Eurostar early next morning. The hotel is about 5 min walk from both so for a quick stop over is ideal. The room was small but clean. Toilet and shower both in a small room (about 2' x 4') but provided what we needed. Walls a bit thin and floor boards all creek but once it got to about midnight all was quiet. Was up to early to get breakfast which starts at 7 so can't comment. Clean towels and small shower gel. For what we wanted it was fine. Would not want to stay more than one night though.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry, no.”
Reviews.Author: WI Boy
Reviews.Content: Maybe if you're taking the Eurostar and you only stay for one night, but otherwise, I wouldn't recommend this hotel. The room was so small the door hit the bed. The toilet didn't always flush, there was mold in the bathroom, the people in the room across the courtyard were up late and noisy. The hallways are super narrow and all of the fire doors make it difficult to get through with a suitcase. No internet and the weekend desk clerks were unfriendly. A good breakfast doesn't make up for all of that.

Reviews.Title: “Low budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: someone1Ljubljana
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location, just round the corner of St Pancrass and Kings Cross stations. The reception looks decent, the staff at the reception are nice enough, we got extra towels and the shower gel was replaced when used. But that's where it ends unfortunately. The russian breakfast staff (the girl serving) is robotic at best, so don't expect any smiles or warm greetings. The english breakfast didn't taste that good, once the toast was mouldy and I found a small bug in my coffe. The rooms are in a bad shape and need to be renovated. The closet paint is peeling, the windows were filthy, the bathroom has a shower head popping from the wall with no shower curtain or glass and the toilet and sink are very near. The sink is so small you can hardly wash your hands so it's completely disfunctional. There is no place to put your toiletries or a towel. You basically have to have them on your bed or in your suitcase. There isn't one shelve or a table. The sink and toilet were clean though. The bed was too small and the matress lumpy. The walls are so thin you hear a person sneeze in the next room. The floors and stairs make so much noise we didn't sleep for 4 nights as people were walking in the middle of the night. That's the biggest complaint. If you care for your sleep just avoid. if feel the room should be priced max 50 pounds.

Reviews.Title: “basic but what we expected for the price”
Reviews.Author: angela w
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews before going to this hotel so we wasn't expecting the ritz. We took our own kettle and brew facilities which we wouldn't have done if we hadn't read previously, On the whole we where presently surprised with the room. Yes it was small with 3 single beds, the bathroom was adequate quite clean but not spotless. The sheets where changed each day but the quilt covers don't get changed as often. I would say they where not fresh for our stay, but not filthy either and it was that warm we didn't need them. Clean towels both days although they where a bit worn they did the job. I agree to the walls being thin but where fortunate as we didn't get any rowdy people. The breakfast was fab and a good start to the day. The dining room was busy but we didn't have a problem being seated and the service was quick, All the staff where pleasant and efficient.would definitely stop again as it was so convenient. If you want a 5 star accommodation this is not for you but if you want cheap and cheerful then this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Juliana1989
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, really close to the St. Pancras Station, McDonals, Burger King. But the hotel is horrible. If you want to stay in this area, there many others hotels for you to choose, located very close to this one. But dont stay here. The breakfast is good, theres a choice between english breakfast and cereal but there's only a few tables and two women to serve and they are very clumsy, so you have to get there early or to wait a while. Our room smelled musty, there was not hot water whenever you want mainly in the morning. And on the last day we spent the whole day without hot water and we couldnt take a shower and when we complain the guy in the reception was really rude and said that was nothing he could do about, they dont care about the guests. Was horrible, we were really tired and only wanted to take a shower and relax before leaving. I will never stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “basic but good value”
Reviews.Author: loversofsunshine
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very good location close to kings cross and st Pancras stations ,the hotel seems to be in the process of being updated .as our original room was very basic (no 30) and very old fashioned We asked if there was any other rooms available and we were offered room 1a this room was far better In the information it says that there is tea and coffee, but this you do have to ask for if you wish to make one yourself there were no facilities in the room to make one yourself In the information it also states a full English breakfast you have to ask for the cereals you do get orange juice ,tea and coffee as well as toast and jam The cooked breakfast consists of bacon,eggs,sausage and beans which in fairness is actually very tasty All thing considered this is a basic but value for money b&b in a very good location

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it if you can”
Reviews.Author: DennisWB
Reviews.Content: Passing through London, we needed a place for a night close to King's Cross railway station, as we were leaving early the next morning, and this seemed Ok. But in fact, for Â£80 (US$130) small I suppose we could have got something better. The room was a cubicle with barely enough room to walk around the two very narrow single beds (we'd asked for a double), let alone open our suitcases. The lavatory is in the "room" as there is not enough space for it in what is supposed to be the bathroom. Truthfully, shower and toilet share a space no larger than 2x5ft. We also had the misfortune of staying at the top floor, which meant carrying heavy suitcases four flights of incredibly narrow stairs. At least the place'appeared reasonably clean. Breakfast was edible.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, simple, clean - great location for Kings Cross”
Reviews.Author: Chris71London
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel for just one night (out with friends for leaving drinks) that was close to Kings Cross train & tube stations. Less than 5 minutes walk, the hotel was very basic (very cheap) and simple. My single room was small but very clean. The bed was actually a little larger than a single bed (perhaps a 3/4 bed?) ... Clean towels and the toilet / shower room was fine - shower gel & soap included (some budget hotels don't bother with these!). I would recommend this hotel for it's location and cleanliness however don't expect luxury - you get what you pay for but it's ideal for a nights sleep if you need to be near Kings Cross.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Breakfast and an Ok room”
Reviews.Author: wowok2travel
Reviews.Content: The room was ok, tolerable for the price. The location is great, really close to kings cross station. The big plus would be the breakfast, I would definitely take advantage of the free breakfast. You get an English Breakfast, Eggs, Delicious Toast, Beans and Ham, Also you can have unlimited coffee and oj. Breakfast is from 7 a.m. - 9 a.m.

Reviews.Title: “Another useful stay”
Reviews.Author: vallico2008
Reviews.Content: This time I booked a single but got a double room downstairs. View through window not endearing but a lovely quiet space, immaculately clean. Good breakfast, lovely lady on reception who is always friendly and helpful. It's a bargain for an overnight stay and can not be faulted as a budget hotel. Strange but nice, they serve loose leaf tea and not tea bags.

Reviews.Title: “Basic and clean hotel, Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Malaga.Spain
Reviews.Content: We have stayed several times in Howard Hotel. if you are looking for hotel well located and to use as a base, this is your hotel. ItÂ´s located in Argyle square, a small square 1 minute walk from King Cross Station, this is a must you can reach any transportation from there. It has lots of restaurants, bars and shops within walking distance. The hotel is small and clean. DonÂ´t expect luxury. If possible ask for a exterior room, we had a triple one ensuite, beds were ok and it was very clean. English breakfast included in the price is a must. Staff are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - good for a short stay in London”
Reviews.Author: preedijk
Reviews.Content: Superb location in a decent neighborhood, close to kings cross / st pancras station with six underground lines and easy connections to all parts of the city and all airports. The hotel has basic rooms, which are nice and clean, but there is quite a lot of noise from other rooms in the hotel. Shower and toilet look like they are cleaned superficially, but not very thoroughly. There was no towel rack and no shelves to put anything on while in the shower; not a big problem, but not very practical either. There is a 24h dront desk with friendly staff and where you can get a free â€˜Smart saveâ€™-map which features a city map, underground map and 20% discounts to many popular attractions and restaurants around the city. Room prices were very good compared to other hotels in the area. I would consider coming to the Howard Winchester again for a couple of nights, but I would not recommend it for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very close to Kings Cross/St Pancras”
Reviews.Author: HookedOnTravel255103
Reviews.Content: Basic hotel with very basic provisions in the room (soap!). Hairdryer was available on request. Room was very clean and cooked breakfast delicious. Breakfast was served in a 'United Nations'-style environment; brightly decorated room and sharing tables. Fun. This hotel is recommended if you are staying one night to break up a journey as I was, or if you really do intend to only sleep at the hotel. It is very close to Kings Cross station. Area is not good for wandering in the evening. Bear in mind that there is no lift.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy and not enough sleep”
Reviews.Author: littleanna777
Reviews.Content: We had "luck" to stay in a triple room right next to the breakfast room. It was extremely noisy from 7am and we were unable to sleep, moreover people in the room next door were talking and laughing till about 4am until the receptionist came to calm them down. Sleep was appalling, cardboard walls, shabby towels, tea facilities without any tea, just kettle and cups. Piece of chewing gum stuck on the wall above the bed and very dirty shower head. Finish on a good note, the bed was comfy and clean. Reception staff were very friendly and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, free WiFi”
Reviews.Author: hisilverawy
Reviews.Content: Basic comfort and free wi-fi plus a hearty breakfast -- a price performer. Just a block from the St. Pancras station and subways and a main busline to Hyde Park, Harrod's. Helpful desk clerk. Arrive early and you stow your bags in the breakfast room in the basement. It's helpful if you have heavy bags to have a basement room because the stairs our narrow. Our triple (pictured) was big enough for us and three suitcases. It's not a posh neighborhood, but this hotel is on a gracious square surrounding a park, quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect match to its description”
Reviews.Author: VolvoC30
Reviews.Content: Most of the reviews said it was "cheap and cheerfull!" It was exactly that. We needed a cheap place close to Kings Cross and Euston stations. The tiny room was clean and adequate; although the shower needs a mkeover. We paid only Â£70 for the room including a good cooked breakfast. Where in London would you get the equivalent? If you are looking for a short stay...don't hesitate; I've stayed in much worse for three times the price.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, Clean, Central to Kings X - ideal for my needs!”
Reviews.Author: JosieG90
Reviews.Content: The rooms were immaculate and the one I stayed in was rather small, however as I used it as a pit stop to sleep rather than cosying down each day it was ideal due to the cheapness. The breakfast was edible, but not a choice of eggs and juice which would've been nice. Location is ideal for people travelling on the underground everyday or arriving from Kings X Station. Hosts were very friendly and happily kept my luggage safe as I arrived three hours before their check in time, meaning I had free time to explore London. Sleepwise was ok, however it can get rather noisy and with my window open could smell cigarettes and weed from the street, but I did have a room with a street view. All in all really give this hotel a shot if you're just wanting to sleep in there.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and clean.”
Reviews.Author: Margolis73
Reviews.Content: Place is cheap, clean and most of all in a key position near King's Cross station. So basically at the center of the travel hub in London. The venue is however small, small stairs, small breakfast room (it was chock full, I got to have breakfast out). But I got the unlucky room in the basement. In 2011 in London no unlucky room should exist in 'hotels'. Otherways they should be called B&B or hostels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Very Helpful”
Reviews.Author: GridWalls
Reviews.Content: Was just what we wanted. They were sooo helpful - we had a last minute addition of our daughter to our party and they were able to accommodate us on short notice. They let us leave our bags in the rooms early before check in so we did not have to lug them around London. The breakfast was a hit with everyone - nothing like a good meal to start a long day of sight seeing. It was very basic but it was clean and reasonably priced. It was only a short walk to the Tube and St. Pancras Station. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Small room near the Tube and the Chunnel stations”
Reviews.Author: RonKosh
Reviews.Content: The Howard is just a block away from the King's Cross Tube station and less than 2 blocks from the Chunnel station. I stayed two nights there. The rooms are small but clean. There is only a very basic shower and a tiny TV. The walls are thin so bring your earplugs! It's not the Ritz but for 55 pounds how can you complain? Also some interesting little restaurants and stores nearby. Staff was friendly and the english breakfast was good. I will stay again and spend my money at the pubs.

Reviews.Title: “CHEAP AND CHEERFUL”
Reviews.Author: watchdog54
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night recently and agree with the general tone of other reviews. It is cheap (Â£55 for a single room) and clean. My room was tiny, with just about enough space for my case. The tiny shower cubicle might not suit those of more generous proportions, but I managed to squeeze in and out of it without injury. The check-in was rather odd. A man of middle-eastern origin was sitting on the outside step, bellowing into a mobile phone and smoking. Another middle eastern type was lounging in the 'foyer'. When the smoking man continued with his phone call the other man got up and gave me a room key. The second man then joined us and I was asked to sign a bit of paper. Neither man spoke much English. I was beginning to wonder what on earth I had booked into. But the room seemed OK and I felt reasonably reassured. Very nice young lady on reception the next day, and a decent enough full English breakfast. For 55 quid in central London you can't expect much more.

Reviews.Title: “Still excellent value for London”
Reviews.Author: vallico2008
Reviews.Content: A warm room on a cold night in London for Â£45? Can't complain. My fifth visit and as clean as ever. What it needs is tea making facilities and a lamp rather than harsh overhead lighting. The reception staff are always welcoming and helpful. I had a very efficient plug in radiator this time so had a very good night's sleep in a comfy bed. Breakfast is always good.If you need somewhere to sleep near the station this is perfect. No frills. That's fine!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Vivi38
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect located in a quiet street very close to from Kings Cross st. Pancras station, and therefore very easily access to trains to Gatwick Airport. The only noise we were disturbed by was a couple of times the fire brigade was driving in the main road near by. The room was small, but nice, newly decorated, and practical. The breakfast was not very good. But it never is at these kind of small, cheap hotels in London, I think. There are a handfull of pleasent restaurants and pizzerias in the neighbourhood, easy to reach by foot. The hotel is in walking distance to Camden Town, where you can easily spend 1-2 days, it takes less than Â½ an hour to go there.

Reviews.Title: “Howard Winchester Kings Cross”
Reviews.Author: RobEvans_11
Reviews.Content: It is what it is, claen tidy and well priced It's more of a large Guest House than a small Hotel which means from a customer service suffers somewhat as there is none of the owner interest that you'd get from a guest house or the proper staff training that you'd get from a hotel. A word of warning 3 people turned up for breakfast at 2 minutes past 9 and were turned away quite brusquely! As previous posters have said, rooms are clean but small and the walls and floors need soundproofing.

Reviews.Title: “short stay”
Reviews.Author: mark b
Reviews.Content: This is marked as Hotel, but it is no where near a Hotel. It is a b&b, but at least it was a clean one. The welcome was also very freindly. You could see where the money had been spent, and that was on the reception. The rooms we're small, but clean. One problem i found was being over 6ft tall, the bed was to short. My feet hung out over the end. The breakfast was very good and there was plenty of it. You are only a few minutes walk away from kings cross, and that is a good location . Would i stay there again ? I would say yes, but there are other places around the area to look at first. All in all, it was clean and tidy for Â£65.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling”
Reviews.Author: CarolinePenny
Reviews.Content: Did not have a good sleep at all at the Howard Winchester Hotel, not at all. The room was overheated and dusty, but the worst thing were the thin walls... In the room above me, a couple spent the first half of the night on arguing very loudly, and the second half on making up. I considered getting up and going to the reception to complain but as I am a solo female traveller, I'm not too keen on wandering about in the halls of a funny hotel late at night. As I did not have the time the previous night to have dinner, I was looking forward to an English breakfast in the morning - which was included in the price (Â£70 through Booking.com). But that was by far the greasiest breakfast which I ever saw. I toughened up and took a bite of the bacon - which sank to my stomach and stayed there like a brick for three days. I thought the poached egg would be better - but that just was a piece of rubber swirled in grease. Coffee was equally appalling. And the staff aren't exactly happy to see you either - though I endured all of it without complaining. Never go there, there are much better B&Bs around St Pancras for the same price (please see my review of the Belgrove Hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money - small but clean.”
Reviews.Author: eicon2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a single room for one night whilst attending a conference. The hotel is very close to Kings Cross station but was quiet - I didn't hear any noise from the station or the street. Be warned, there is no lift/elevator or porter so you will have to carry luggage up a small narrow staircase. The bed in my room was actually a bit bigger than a single and was very comfortable with clean bedding. A wardrobe was provided, which is just as well, as there was no floor space to put a suitcase on. The bathroom was absolutely tiny but was spotlessly clean. It consists of a toilet, wash hand basin with a shower above it and a shower curtain. However it worked very well. The Â£55 per night rate included a full English breakfast - mountains of toast with butter, jam and marmalade, orange juice, a large pot of tea or coffee, sausage, bacon, eggs and beans. The breakfast room is quite cramped and busy so you just have to sit anywhere you can find a space - I shared with a young foreign couple, followed by an older British couple. The kitchen staff do not speak much English so you can only say yes or no to breakfast rather than asking for anything to be included/excluded. On the whole I found the hotel to be clean and friendly and excellent value for money. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped but bearable”
Reviews.Author: JemimaBond
Reviews.Content: Had an overnight stay and chose it because of close proximity to Euston Station. But the real reason was because it was relatively cheap for 65pounds b&b. These are the pros and cons: Pros- -cheap n cheerful,the reception was actually impressive,but it sort of ended there -across the road from Kings Cross and St pancras station,10min walk to euston -room was clean,thank god. -good idea to separate the wash basin from the toilet/shower -good hot breakfast -value for money due to ensuite -hot water but maybe cause we took a shower at 630am! (jet lag) Cons -tiny room with equally tiny shower and toilet -three bags pretty much took all the floor space -was a super single bed rather than a double, so very tight for two adults -no aircon,but window opened and it was cool nite -the spout on the wash basin too big, so water splashed everywhere -water from the shower was a trickle at most I would say that its good for max 2nites and no more before claustrophobia sets in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & cozy”
Reviews.Author: camiac
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great: 3 minutes walk to St. Pancras King`s Cross station. The staff are very friendly. The room was very small, but clean and comfortable. The only problem was the window that wouldn`t open. But they offered me a fan. I had a very good night`s sleep. They also have plug adaptors. The breakfast was too much for me, but there are 2 Paul bakeries and 2 Starbucks coffeehouses in the St. Pancrass stations. Overall, it is a good place to sleep for 1 or 2 nights, if you need to be very close to St. Pancras station.

Reviews.Title: “Expect Basic customer service and accomodation”
Reviews.Author: sueandh
Reviews.Content: We paid Â£62.00 per nigh for B&B and stopped two nights. Is near to Kings Cross St Pancreas. Hotel has no lifts had to carry our large cases up two flights of stairs with no assistance. Reception staff are there basically to take your money, nothing else..... Rooms were basic but clean, and very small the shower was a joke no where to put soap or shampoo when having shower except the floor? Asked reception if they would book us a taxi to take us to Victoria on our last day and they refussed. Also witness a guest asking for a glass of water as she was feeling unwell and they refussed. The staff on reception lack customer service skills, only intrested in taking your money I guess... wont stop there again.

Reviews.Title: “basic but clean and central”
Reviews.Author: bigal1971
Reviews.Content: We were not sure just what expect from this hotel after reading various reviews but were pleasantly surprised. The rooms are very basic and showers not the best but what do you expect for budget accomadation just 4 minutes walk from King's Cross Station! However the rooms were clean and tidy and cleaned daily. Even with the window open the only traffic sounds you really hear is sirens. The daytime reception staff were very kind and helpful - they even let you keep your bags safe after you check out if you want to hop on the tube for that last minute bit of shopping before you catch your train home. The kitchen staff not as much but don't think she spoke much english apart from what did we want. At the end of your day if you want somewhere within VERY easy reach of the trains & tube and don't have champagne tastes for a budget wallet then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Basic place to rest your head .,.,”
Reviews.Author: ukCorn
Reviews.Content: If you are a diva or a princess, then this is not the hotel for you. It's bare bone minimum in this place. No pictures on the room walls and virtually no where to put your stuff. The creakiness of the building is annoying - especially if you are low down in the building. We were in the basement so heard every guest come and go. Smokers congregated outside the front door of the hotel and so we had to keep closing our window to minimize the smoke floating down. Suggest requesting a room high up and at the back of the building. Breakfast girls are an unsmiling lot and fail to tell you what's on offer. If you ask, they do have cereal, but you need to know that ahead of time! On the plus - the bathroom was new and spacious (6 foot tub). Plenty of hot water and good water pressure for showers. Food was good and always quickly served. Superb location for a Eurostar departure/arrival - you walk to the St Pancras station from here. Cleanliness not superb but not awful either. They never vacummed behind the door nor did they dust the chair rail in our room - but the bathroom and other areas of the room were cleaned daily. Hallways very narrow and no lift - bit awkward for large, heavy suitcases. I would look elsewhere before returning here but perhaps for central london at this price, that's as good as it gets. (PS TV - it does work in the basement - you needed to press another button on the TV to get the over-the-air channels)

Reviews.Title: “It isn't a hotel....it lacks many of the things that every traveler should expect in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: drh3177
Reviews.Content: It should not call itself a hotel because it is at best a bed and breakfast. The Pluses It is reasonable for central London where nothing is reasonable It is well located It is clean! The breakfast (particularly if you like ham and bacon and you don't mind raising your cholesterol a bit, is more than adequate but you better be an early riser...they cut it off early! The lady and gentleman who own it are quite nice, It is quiet the Minuses: I have never before spent a night in a hotel with virtually nowhere to put your luggage and those things that you pack in your luggage. They seem to have decided not to buy furniture. We were put in a windowless room in the basement, and worried about what we might do in case of fire It was HOT and they did provide a fan when we and they noticed that the room was over 90 degrees Fahrenheit at the time of check-in. We have friends in London, and our cell phones do not work in London so staying in the first place I have ever stayed in without in-room phones was a real problem. Have you ever stayed in a hotel where the TV's have no reception as the owners have chosen not to subscribe to any TV service, and there seemed to be no over-the-air service?

Reviews.Title: “Not the best hotel, but nice and cozy”
Reviews.Author: JacekCh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to King's Cross station (buses, underground, rail), but still peaceful and quiet. Room was small but comfortable. There were some technical issues, but overall the hotel is worth its price.

Reviews.Title: “Great No Frills Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lou478
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located near Kings Cross and St Pancras Railway Stations. The rooms are clean and tidy. The staff are friendly and very helpful, the breakfast is very tasty and there is enough to eat. Even though the location is very near the statiosn, the hotel itself is very quiet and you can get a decent night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: zzao
Reviews.Content: This is a very functional place to stay, it has quite a grand entrance hall compared to the rest of the building, but we did not find any problem, as we just slept here, spending the days and nights out and about. The room was fine and comfortable enough, the whole place does creak a bit, but not dramatically, and we did not make breakfast either day so can not comment on that. If you want a cheap, central spot in London just to lay your head, this should do fine - have already booked a room for one night before an early morning Eurostar later in the year.

Reviews.Title: “Relocation upon arrival”
Reviews.Author: GrunfSweden
Reviews.Content: We were "relocated" to a sister-facility, Hotel California, upon arrival. The standard of this facility was notably lower, with smaller rooms etc., but we had to pay the same rate and were given no explanation.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff, poor service, pay an extra Â£10 and stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Metzy166
Reviews.Content: I am someone who stays overnight in budget hotels everywhere I go. All I ask is to have somewhere clean & to be treated in the polite manner I treat others (so really not very fussy). I booked this hotel 2 months ago for myself and my partner who has incurable cancer. I placed on the booking form that we needed a ground floor room and to check in slightly before 1pm, as we were travelling from Manchester. I also rang up and asked if this was ok and was told it wasn't a problem. To cut it short we turned up and were treated with contempt from the young man on reception whom I showed the booking form to. He eventually gave us a key to a room on the top floor. We said nothing and just struggled up very narrow stairs to the top floor. The room was clean, but there was no info regarding the hotel, breakfast, suggestions, complaints or complaints book. The next day I went to the dinning room at 09:11 and sat down at a table. Two women came from the kitchen & started yelling "no more, we finished, you go!!!". Other diners tucking into their breakfast burst out laughing. I asked the lady to stop shouting and said it was ok, but would it be possible to get a cup of coffee? The two eastern european women started to yell at me in another language. I got up and left the dinning room. I informed my 3 friends and my partner, whom were still in there rooms what had happened. After my friend tipped (around Â£10) the kitchen staff we got some toast and coffee. One of the kitchen women said later " I tell boss you weren't told time to eat tomorrow". I said thanks but I'll put my own review on Trip advisor. For Â£65 it isn't worth the money, pay an extra Â£10 and get treated with decency. The same man was still on reception when I checked out and my partner informed him that he forgot to inform us when breakfast was, the man was very rude and we just paid up and left. The staff are obviously treated very poorly by the hotel managment and it transcends through to the customer. Worst hotel I have never stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for St Pancras - that's about it!”
Reviews.Author: chepstu
Reviews.Content: Having not wanted to stay in a dump before an early start on the Eurostar - I read the many tripadvisor reviews of hotels around the Station. The outside and reception of the hotel looks very good - clean and modern - big plasma TV in reception. The guy was not your ordinary receptionist - but quite funny! The room was up a narrow and creaky staircase - and was small. It has two small beds (sort of luxury camp beds) that were very narrow - but comfortable enough. The main problem was the lack of sound insulation - as it lends itself to a 24hr in's and out's - you of course have people up/down stairs banging doors etc - so if you are staying take some earplugs. We left too early to try breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Peled
Reviews.Content: Do not expect a room of 50 to look like one of 100. It is very clean. The bed was very comfortable. The bath room small but clean. Quite sufficient for a short stay. The breakfast is good. No phone in the room. Problem is that there is no sufficient light to read a book in the bed. Also, I stayed in the lower floor (room 35). It was very noisy. Every one opening the door to the stairways, caused the walls to shudder. I was lucky to go to sleep late. Otherwise evry one moving around would have waken me up. The location is great. Very good for the price. Do not expect a large room with all the facilities of an expensive hotel. I was looking for a place to sleep at night and have a shower at the end of the day, all for a reasonable price. I got what I wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Very acceptable budget option”
Reviews.Author: Julian&Moira
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights, visiting family in London. I was a single traveller but was allocated a double room (I think most solo travellers at this hotel get a double). My room was in the basement with a view of a tiny quadrangle but was quiet (no traffic noise) and I wasn't there to admire the view. The room was a reasonable size for one person, my bed was comfortable and the bed linen was clean. The shower - when it worked (no hot water on my 2nd morning) - was ok and there was a t.v. that worked in the room (but no remote control to access ceefax). The cooked breakfast was adequate without being generous but everything was hot and there was proper HP sauce on the table....a real bonus. Somewhat quirkily, however, the tea pot had real tea in it but no strainer to filter the leaves; very odd, but I've had worse breakfasts at much dearer hotels. All in all this is a good budget option but clearly not the place for a romantic weekend. I would stay here again if I was on my own. Finally, this would be a good overnighter if someone was catching an early morning Eurostar as St Pancras is visible from the front of the hotel. The front desk staff are friendly and helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “Very Shabby”
Reviews.Author: stwrtd
Reviews.Content: Lobby of hotel extremely nice,marble floor and lovely decoration. Room was a different story, door of bathroom was smashed in from one side, handle fell off wardrobe door when opened. At night noise was horrendous,slamming of doors till 3 oclock in morning Shower noise was also ridiculously loud sounded like water pipes would burst any minute. Suffice to say we got about 2 hours sleep all night.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet street (amazingly), great location for transport”
Reviews.Author: WandererOttawa_CAN
Reviews.Content: I booked into this hotel Oct 17 to 22/09 and paid 49 pounds per night (when I booked, the pound was about $1.73Can, so I was pleased to pay less than $100/nt). Surprised at great location to King's Cross Station, and St, Pancras International Station for train trip to and from Gatwick Airport. One block in from Euston Rd, which is a busy street, yet the room was quiet in the evenings and mornings, even with my window open onto the front street - with a small park across the road. My room was (small) intimate, with an even smaller bathroom (had shower and sink and toilet), but how much time will you spend in the room? Room was tidy and the bed sheets were clean, all I really ask for in a room. Breakfast was available with the room, and breakfast room was located in the basement. I booked this hotel based on ratings of other TripAdisor comments, with the only neg comments being about the breakfast room staff (two young women). This is also my only complaint about the place. The two staffers couldn't crack a smile or "good morning" greeting for anyone who walked into the room. They were efficiant - got the toast and tea onto the tables quickly, but some of those toast baskets hit the tables awfully fast, if you know what I mean. I asked the day manager (?) if she had ever read the TripAdvisor comments about the breakfast staff, and her response was that this was one of the few hotels that offered breakfast with the room, so the implication was that we should be thankful and accept whatever moodiness the staff may have. oh well. I would recommend this hotel for its location, cleanliness, super great location to the tube station, the charm of the area, the surprising quiet of the street, and even the bed was comfy. And, hey, you're in London!!!!

Reviews.Title: “In London - value for money, anywhere else - poor.”
Reviews.Author: Marta W
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in October for a weekend in London. As we did not want to spend plenty on accomodation this hotel was fine. The standard was ok for London as I guess you tend to pay much more for a decent room there. Location was brilliant, rooms were clean, reception desk helpful. Breakfast was nothing special (but it was free...), on the second morning no hot water. If you prefer to spend money on other things than amazing hotel, then I recommend this place. Would come back if in London again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: tiggosaurus
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night after a trip to the theatre - the hotel was only a stone's throw from Kings Cross, so excellently placed for tube connections to the West End. Despite this, the hotel is set back in a quiet residential-type square and there was hardly any noise from the street (and I had a room at the front too). I had booked a single room and was pleasantly surprised to find it contained a very comfortable Queen-size bed. The ensuite consisted of a wetroom style shower with a loo and a sink at either end. No tea/coffee-making facilities, but I wouldn't have used them anyway. The lobby was very smartly decorated and modern, the room a little bit more worn, but still perfectly acceptable for the price I paid (Â£49 for bed and breakfast). The downstairs dining room was clean and bright, breakfast was tasty and served very promptly (egg, sausage, bacon, beans and toast together with tea/coffee and orange juice). The only downside was the lack of a lift, though the receptionist did offer to help carry my bag up the three flights of stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: nes33
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights as a theatre weekend trip. Had 4 rooms between us all and all 4 rooms were comfortable. Granted, they are small BUT the price warrants that. We found all staff friendly and accomodating. The location is superb for getting around the City. All in all we had a great weekend and The Howard Winchester suited our needs.

Reviews.Title: “OK Stay”
Reviews.Author: liz28
Reviews.Content: Hotel very easy to locate from St Pancreas. our room was ok with a clean bed. television and shower good breakfast included in price of Â£60 per night for myself and my husband. only stayed the one night as it was booked late due to a change of train times.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: bunny79_9
Reviews.Content: We arrived late on a Friday to a warm welcome from the man behind the desk. We picked this hotel as we had an early train from St Pancras and wanted to be as near as possible. It was easy to find and was a 2 minute walk from St Pancras. We stayed in room number 1 which had a double and a single bed, telly, wardrobe and adjoining bathroom. The room was very basic. The shower was the main let down in that it just had no power. Cheap hotel, it met our needs and is in a great location if getting the Eurostar. If you're arriving late at night and leaving early in the morning then I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small room”
Reviews.Author: wearygypsy
Reviews.Content: Booked a twin - this room was so small there wasn't anyplace to put our suitcases. Sink was in the room with us. Breakfast was marginal. Kitchen help not attentive - after waiting for 10 min. had to go into the kitchen to get some service, and found the help chatting with friends who were visiting (and quickly made an exit once I entered). The owner/ are very pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Small, cheap and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Vyacheslav
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for the British F1 GrandPrix at Silverstone. Chose this hotel based on low rate (including breakfast) and proximity to train stations. The hotel is conveniently located in a quiet square just meters away from Kings Cross and St.Pancras, Euston station is 15 minutes walk. Tube and bus stops are near and there are lots of restaurants and shops in the area. The single room is very small, barely enough to fit a bed (and a good one!), a nightstand and a cabinet. The washbasin is in the room, toilet and shower are behind the glass door. Thereâ€™s even a small TV. Everything was in good working order if a little outdated. Walls are not soundproof and while you wonâ€™t hear much street noise, noisy neighbors could be a problem. Be aware that thereâ€™s no lift and the stairs are quite steep. English breakfast was good and served early, even on weekend, reception staff very helpful. Had no problems at all, this hotel is very good value for the money. Thereâ€™s no internet access in the hotel, but St.Pancras station 100 meters away offer free Wi-Fi.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: ellesbelles57
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Howard Winchester having been snowed in at work. I booked online, and have to say I did so with a certain amount of trepidation since room was so inexpensive. I am pleased, however, to be able to report that I was pleasantly surprised! The location itself is extremely convenient, just steps away from Kings Cross station. I arrived a little before midnight, just as anothe family were checking in. I therefore had a few minutes to warm myself by the fire and watch the large flat screen tv whilst waiting for my turn. Upon being given the key I was directed to my room which was through a door and down a small and narrow staircase. I have to say, at the door from reception is where he luxury stops, and from there on the facilities are basic to say the least. The room itself was tiny! two single beds and an en suite bathroom - so small it had a sliding door which when opened leads pretty much straight into the shower. A toilet is tucked around the side of the shower with a corner sink in front. That's it! Having said that, for its bijou size, it was perfectly clean and modern and appeared quite freshly decorated. The bed was very comfortable and the bed linen fresh and crisp. there is a small wardrobe with a somewhat dated TV (no cable). The room was double glazed so no outside traffic noise, although the corridors were quite noisy and I had the misfortune to be next to the loudest German family who seemed to spend the night wandering around making racket.and banging doors. Breakfast in the morning was functional but fine. There was no menu, I was asked if I wanted full English, and that's what I got! It was very nice, well cooked and plentiful. The purpose of my stay was to put my head down somewhere clean and comfortable for the night and for Â£40 I got exactly that. I am not sure I would have enjoyed my stay if I had had to spend any time in the room itself as it was too small to do anything but sleep really, but that suited me fine so I was perfectly happy with my choice and felt it represented excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “As tiny as a prison cell”
Reviews.Author: Itamarl
Reviews.Content: The room was so tiny that it reminded me a prison cell. There was no place for my laguagge (one suitcase and one trolley) so I had to move them around whenever I wanted to go to the bathroom or out of the room. It was even difficult to enter the bathroom - and I'm only 1.70meter and 71kg. The tv was on top of the closet - just try to lay down and watch it and you'll end with a pain in your neck. Breakfest was very basic. As I keep Kosher I asked for a boiled egg instead of egg and bacon but was turned down. The location is good, just 2 minutes walk from King's Cross. It was excellent for me, as I arrived from Luton and the train goes to King's Cross. The reception desk was friendly. The room and other facilities were clean. Some of you might say: that's what you get for 50 Pounds a night. Maybe, but I don't think that being able to move around in the room is too much to ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Howard Winchester Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jon&Teresa
Reviews.Content: Room was very basic with twin beds, wardrobe, portable tv and ensuite shower room. The dÃ©cor was somewhat lacking, window cracked, toilet seat hanging off and central heating on full. Beds were quite soft, so I had a twinge of back ache in the morning. TV reception wasnâ€™t very good, and the shower room is really basic (youâ€™ll need your own shampoo). The breakfast was ok, but was small portions. One bacon, one sausage, one egg and toast. Tea was made with neat tea leaves and no sieve. Lady serving was eastern European, so she couldnâ€™t understand what we were asking for. However, in saying that, you pay for what you get. The Hotel is 3mins from Kings Cross / St Pancras. The Hotel staff were kind and receptive, and kindly looked after our bags after weâ€™d checked out. The room was fairly quiet on a night. Itâ€™s an ideal place if youâ€™re looking for a hotel near Kings Cross that is cheap, and if decor doesn't bother you. We paid Â£60 for two people to stay on a Saturday night. Although my experience wasnâ€™t that bad, I would definitely stop in the Kings Cross Travel Lodge next time. You donâ€™t spend that much time in your room, but itâ€™s still nice to have somewhere you feel more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: GavinKennedy
Reviews.Content: -Great value for money hotel - friendly staff - 2 minutes walk from Kings Cross i would stay here again when on weekend breaks in London, the hotel is not the Ritz but clean and comfortable and great value for money and in a good location for underground and eurostar train lines

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but clean & cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Florence21
Reviews.Content: This is a no frills budget hotel but ideal for an overnight stay en route via Kings Cross or Eurostar. It was clean, had a comfortable bed and there was no noise disturbance. The gentleman on the desk took my case up to the room. When I woke I went down to an english breakfast served very quickly and included in the price. All the staff were friendly and helpful. I consider it good value for money especially convenient when all you are wanting is a stopover en route

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel stay ever !”
Reviews.Author: portsmouth_sam
Reviews.Content: We booked one night at the Howard Winchester as an overnight stop as we were getting in from Eurostar late and didn't want to travel back to Portsmouth on the same night as we had a little one. We'd booked it as it was close to St Pancras so we wouldn't have far to travel once we'd got off the train. The website looked ok and the photo's looked ok. We got to the hotel at 11pm at night with 3 suitcases and a very tired little girl who was all Disney'd out. The man behind the desk didn't even stop taking his personal call, he just passed the key to us and told us to go through a door. Didn't tell us where to go once we were through the door so I left my mum and very tired daughter and went wandering, the man behind the desk didn't want to help at all. I discovered we had to lug these bags down a few steps and then a flight of stairs to get to our room. Once we got to our room there were 3 single beds with about 6 inches between them a wet room and a TV. The lock on the door was dodgy so I hardly slept all night wondering if someone was going to break in. All the fire doors were wedged open with the fire extingishers which apart from being against the law made me even more uneasy that if the hotel did catch fire we were right at the bottom and our only means of escape were through the bedroom window in to a tiny courtyard. Breakfast in the morning was edible but nothing to write home about, the breakfast room is tiny and the tables are so close together you have trouble squeezing past without knocking someone's got tea all over them or you ! As there weren't any tables for 3 available the waitress stroppily said "well sit apart then" on the basis my daughter is 7 I am not about to make her sit on her own for breakfast. I asked if there was any juice as my daughter doesn't drink tea or coffee and got shouted at "I am busy just wait". The whole experience from start to finish was a total disaster. Had I not been so tired from a long and delayed journey home from France and it not been 11pm at night I'd have walked around the square to look for another hotel, but we were just to tired and my little girl needed to get some sleep. I will never stay in this hotel again and I wouldn't recommend anyone else does either, the hotel is in Argyle Square and it is filled with other hotels, so if it's that area you want look for something else. We also stayed at the Travel Lodge London Kings Cross Royal Scot which isn't far and that is much better so if you want something in that area then go for them rather than this hell hole !!

Reviews.Title: “Exvellent location”
Reviews.Author: sunshiner
Reviews.Content: Stayed here night before we were to travel on Eurostar, to save us worrying about getting to London on time. This hotel has recently hada makeover and it shows light and airy entrance but we were down in the basement. No lift so had to lug our cases down several flights of stairs. Room was newly decorated but was dark although could open the window. Bathroom was a wet room. Breakfast starts at 7am but we were told we could be served at 6.30. Staff serving had poor grasp of English, took many repeats to explain what we wanted to eat and drink. Hotel is just across the road from Eurostar so very handy. Nearby are good eating restaurants. Paid Â£60 for the twin room en suite.

Reviews.Title: “The Howard Winchester”
Reviews.Author: laraHowick
Reviews.Content: On visiting the web, the name of the Howard Winchester Hotel came up with a very acceptable sounding description and fairly reasonably priced. The latter is very important for South Africans, with an ever dwindling exchange rate. On enquiry, we were assured they had accommodation available and we then investigated further and found some quite complimentary comments from guests. Well - the reality is completely divorced from the description and commedations available on the internet. We arrived at the hotel, on 13th June, having telephoned confirmation previously, and were greeted by a bolted Reception door with a hand written sign saying use the next door. We rang the bell and after a while, the door was opened. My own first thought on entering the dingy interior was that the carpets and walls had not seen benefit of cleaning for a good 10 years or more. The carpet was filthy and the walls were marked with stains and very dirty. On the left hand side, there was a door into what is presumably the normal reception area, and there was a person sitting behind a desk. Immediately in front of the desk, the carpet had been removed, and there was a large piece of what looked like flattened corrugated iron - quite obviously covering a hole or holes in the floorboards. On the far side of the tin, were some bare floorboards. The receptionist very reluctantly got to his feet, and with some ill will assisted us to take our suitcases down to what can only be described as a basement. I had already told him by this time that I was not happy with the appearance of the hotel, information which did not seem to bother him at all. We had asked for a family room, as it was cheaper for us than a double and a single, but what greeted our astonished eyes was hardly a family room. It looked just like a very basic hostel type of room, three iron bedsteads, paper thin mattresses (and doubtless blankets too, though we did not stay long enough to test that theory), one pillow per bed and the "en suite" was ridiculous. There was an opening from the bedroom into a quarry tiled area which had a handbasin to the left, and to the right a w.c. and, behind a very dirty plastic curtain, a shower which absolutely reeked. There was no door for any of these offices. There was a minute courtyard - overgrown and full of rubbish - outside the window, but no curtains or blinds to speak of, and another room about 2 yards away, which looked directly into our room. We were all stunned with disbelief at the appalling conditions and the final straw was a small black insect-like creature actually crawling over one of the bedspreads. We wasted no further time, but got our suitcases up the stairs and out into the square as fast as possible. I told the receptionist as we passed that we could not stay there, and he did not appear at all surprised or concerned. I then phoned my son who fortunately for us, lives in London, and he very kindly got us into a very nice hotel in Wimbledon. I am fully aware that we chose to go for a cheaper hotel, in the interests of economy, but I wanted to bring this matter to your attention because I am sure we are not the only people to have had such a shattering experience. The booking agent for the hotel confirmed that the description and copies of visitor comments are passed to them by the hotels themselves so they are, presumably acting in good faith, or else is in cahoots with these hotels. I know that it is very difficult to police the internet but I think it would be advantageous if an anonymous inspector could be sent to visit hotels such as the Howard Winchester, and can then take up the misinformation with the people concerned. It makes one most reluctant to take anything at face value on the internet when one has that sort of experience, and in my own opinion, the Howard Winchester is a health hazard of note. Not even in South Africa, which no longer pretends to be first world, have I actually encountered livestock crawling on the beds! I am sending a copy of this letter to the booking agents and to the Department of Health and Safety. I look forward to your comments.

Reviews.Title: “What do you expect for Â£50?!”
Reviews.Author: Romangate
Reviews.Content: Ok - this isn't the Ritz but for Â£50 a night for a single en-suite room which is clean and very well positioned for St. Pancras, I can't complain at all! The "above average" rating I've given the hotel is within my expectations of what I would expect to get for Â£50 in London: the staff were very nice, friendly and helpful, the bed was comfortable, the room was clean as was the en-suite. The only "negative" points were that the walls are thin, so you can hear people in the next room. We chose this hotel because it was so close to St. Pancras station and we had to up early for our 5.30am train. If came here again, I would ask for a top floor room (at least then you wouldn't get anyone walking about above you!) Give it a go - especially by now the refurbishment programme should have been completed!

Reviews.Title: “What nice staff !”
Reviews.Author: vallico2008
Reviews.Content: I arrived late at night and got a warm welcome. The hotel is yards from Kings Cross so was ideal for my late train. The rooms are basic yes, but compact and clean. A very comfy bed as well. Little bathroom was manageable and the shower was a bit " drippy " but warm. Breakfast is in the clean and comfy basment with lovely staff to serve you. Nice cuppa and a cooked breakfast - cooked however you request. The hotel is undergoing alterations and being updated so there were workmen about and a sleep in is not possible at the moment. The staff were friendly and approachable and this little hotel is worth a visit. I like the fact that it overlooks the little square and park.

Reviews.Title: “Very little sleep, hated it!”
Reviews.Author: Sabz1010
Reviews.Content: I needed a budget hotel for a travel conference I was attending. I had read other reviews on here but thought all I need was somewhere to rest my head and get some sleep for 2 nights so thought it would be fine. I was certainly not expecting anything more than 2 star service however nor did I expect to be woken up at 8am each morning by the workmen demolishing the existing reception area!!! We were on the first floor, up and along one from the main entrance (reception)where the work was going on. First night wasn't too bad and I slept alright until the 8am wake up call, hammers, crashing, banging! Nice! The next morning we didn't have to be up so early and were looking forward to sleeping in until 9. (not unreasonable an expectation in my mind) We could hear the guests above us until after 1am (floors are very thin, can hear all movement above you and if I stood in the bathroom I could hear word for word the conversation in the room above us) and then woken up AGAIN by workmen at 8am. I feel we should have been advised this work would be going on, but no mention of it when I booked with the hotel or checked in. I booked direct. Window didn't fully fit the frame so there was about a 1inch gap at the top of it. Shower head needed a clean years ago, it was filthy, the worst I've seen anywhere. The bathroom was basic but had all you need. The room too was basic but again had all we needed for 2 nights and was quite clean. I would not recommend the hotel and would not be staying there again. There are plenty same price range hotels in that area. I do have to say for Kings Cross Stn it's location was ideal, but that and the Â£60 night rate was all it really had going for it. All I wanted was a decent nights sleep and was most unhappy at being woken up through the night by movement above us and then again first thing in the morning by hotel employed workmen. Long days in London coupled with little sleep does not make for a great visit. We didn't stay for Breakfast either morning so can't comment on that. Stay there if you have to but check what work they've got going on as when I went to reception at 8.15 am approx to complain about the noise they didn't really see what my issue was! I was told my room was not directly above it but given the front doors were wide open (noise coming in the 1inch gap in the window) and the walls are so thin I can assure it sounded as though the hotel itself was being demolished underneath us.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location, Great Price, Happy Days!!”
Reviews.Author: NUFC4Life
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed in a family room which cost only Â£90 for the night and included a cooked breakfast in the morning!! The location is superb, a stone's throw away from kings cross station, so very handy for the tube. Please don't be put off by any negative comments if your looking for a cheap, well located hotel for a couple of nights. Ok so it's not the ritz but the beds are clean, the staff are helpful, and a cooked breakfast in the morning certainly sorted my hangover out!! Would go again!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it this time - has it changed hands??”
Reviews.Author: blackdahlia
Reviews.Content: Have to admit to some trepidation upon finding that my friend had booked us a room here, given my previous review - but my fears were groundless! We were given a lovely, comfy room which was spotlessly clean, and we slept really well despite being right at the front of the hotel in a pavement-level room. Excellent breakfast, very friendly service all the way..the only niggle was that they still don't have coffee/tea making facilities, but for the price we paid I honestly can't complain - we just got out bedtime cuppa from the McDonalds on the corner. Have already recommended, and would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Eblana
Reviews.Content: We had one double and one single booked; in fact we were allocated two doubles. We arrived exhausted and drenched (a torrential downpour coincided with getting to London Marylebone). The man on the reception desk was charming and chatty, and the reception area was spotless and nicely decorated with good use of marble and mirrors, in a retro (original dÃ©cor, it turned out) way. The exterior is pleasant, and fairly similar to the other budget hotels on the square. I imagine that those booking this hotel do so because of the excellent location and cheapness of the rooms. One doesn't book a hotel of this sort for its luxury or amenities. The rooms were on the 2nd floor, and there was no lift. The stairs was narrow and steep, but not unmanageable, even for the older member of our party (in her 70s). The rooms are tiny. We faced the square which was nice; we wondered about noise from outside but heard none (although two of our party were woken by loud laughter from late-returning hotel guests during the night). Rooms were immaculately clean (better than some far more expensive hotels I've been in), as were the tiny 'en suites'. In effect, these were lo-tech wet rooms with a shower area at one end, cloaks size sink in the middle, and WC at other end. Lots of hot water. Very small towels. But very clean linen throughout. We did not linger in the rooms, naturally, as we were only there over night en route to the continent via Eurostar the next a.m. The beds were very comfortable, and one of our party has back problems, so that's a good recommendation. Two of our party had the full English breakfast before we left the next day. This was included in the price. It was of a much higher standard than we had expected, with quite nice sausages, and good mushrooms in particular. Bacon not terribly crisp.
